Caption: A section of the audience at the first convocation, at the Open Air Theatre
Description: The first convocation of IIT Madras was held on the 11th July, 1964. The convocation took place on a Saturday evening at the Instituteâ€™s Open Air Theatre and a total of 107 students (92 B. Tech. degrees and 15 M. Sc. degrees) received their degrees.   Dr. A. L. Mudaliar (Padma Bhushan, Padma Vibhushan), the Chairman of the Board of Governors, presided over the ceremony. The chief guest and speaker at this event was Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, second President of India. His Excellency Dr. G. F. Duckwitz, German Ambassador to India, also attended the ceremony and addressed the audience. Front row, fourth from left: Mrs. Shanthi Sengupto
